name: Dave
descriptions: Dave is the self-proclaimed president of the Republic of Dave, a small farmstead on the far northeast edge of the Capital Wasteland in 2277.

After being exiled from the family farmstead (then known as the Kingdom of Tom under the leadership of his father, Tom), Dave made a living operating as a mercenary in and around the Capital Wasteland, and took part in an ill-fated expedition to Fort Constantine along with a handful of other mercenaries on behalf of Allistair Tenpenny. He eventually returned to the Kingdom of Tom and made a coup d'état, renaming it the "Republic of Dave" and giving the citizens the "freedom of democracy" in the form of an annual election, in contrast to the dictatorship of Tom.

Dave decided the marital standards needed changing after inheriting the Republic from his father, allowing polygamous relationships and resulting in his marriage to his second wife, Jessica. The excuse given to his first wife was that he "needed to re-populate the land of Dave so they could grow and soon own all of the Capital Wasteland."
Dave's activities consist of staying in his office and never going outside of the main building in the Republic of Dave.

How the Lone Wanderer greets Dave in their first meeting plays a large role in how Dave will interact with the player character. If greeted with the Wasteland Ambassador route, it will give him a false sense that the Republic is being recognized as sovereign, and he will interact fairly well. If one requests asylum, they will receive a neutral interaction from him from there on out. If one tells Dave that his "Republic is forfeit," Dave and all the other inhabitants of the Republic will become hostile.
Dave appears in Fallout 3 and Fallout Shelter Online.
Playstation 3 Xbox 360 It is possible to pickpocket Dave's special key for the quest You Gotta Shoot 'Em in the Head and then afterward acquire the key a second time by passing a Speech check.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Do you need more than that gift?

topics.topic: MS14CrowleyWhat can you tell me about Mister Crowley?
topics.topic_text: Mister President, do you know a Ghoul named Mister Crowley?
topics.response_text: There's a name I haven't heard in a long time.

topics.topic_text: Mr. President, what's so special about this key?
topics.response_text: You need all the keys to get through Fort Constantine.

topics.topic_text: Mister Crowley is alive. He sent me to kill you because you hate Ghouls.
topics.response_text: Me? Hate Ghouls? Preposterous.

topics.topic_text: Thank you for sharing your wisdom, Mister President.
topics.response_text: It is such a burden being the wisest.

topics.topic_text: Not good enough, Mister President.
topics.response_text: Of course, of course. I should have you killed, but that would be boring.{First part is said dismissively and condescendingly}

topics.topic_text: What happened in the Fort, Mister President?
topics.response_text: Two of us died, including Crowley. The rest achieved the mission goals and were paid.

topics.topic_text: A gift of the key would be a strategic diplomatic move, Mister President.
topics.response_text: Hmm. Of course it would. I knew that. I was just testing you to see if you would realize it.

topics.topic_text: How did Mister Crowley die, Mister President?
topics.response_text: When the Feral Ghouls killed Tara, Dukov realized that he would get more of the commission.

topics.topic_text: I think it would be good for the Republic, Mister President.
topics.response_text: Of course it would. I knew that. You heard me say that before, didn't you. It was my idea after all. Here, take it.

topics.topic_text: Your "Republic" is a joke, and your presidency is a farce. You need to die.
topics.response_text: What! How dare you! I'm going to have you executed.

topics.topic_text: Crowley is alive, Mister President. I'm supposed to bring him the key.
topics.response_text: Alive? I always wondered. He was locked in with a bunch of Feral Ghouls. They won't attack Ghouls, you see.

topics.topic: MS14HereToKillYouI'm here to kill you, and there's nothing you can do about it.
topics.topic_text: Time for the Republic to hold a new election... and a state funeral.
topics.response_text: Assassin!

topics.topic_text: PLAYER JUMP
topics.response_text: Hey, there's no jumping in the capitol.

topics.topic_text: I think I get the idea. Let me ask you something else.
topics.response_text: What now?

topics.topic_text: Most exalted President Dave, I am an ambassador from the Wasteland.
topics.response_text: You are? Excellent. It's good to see that the Wasteland has finally recognized the sovereign Republic of Dave.

topics.topic_text: I'm sorry. I'll just be leaving...
topics.response_text: You do that. Personal note: remind the guards to fire on sight.

topics.topic_text: I am seeking asylum, Mister President.
topics.response_text: Ahh... another victim of persecution seeking protection from the mighty Republic of Dave. We get a lot of that here.

topics.topic_text: If you'll excuse me a moment, I'll be right back.
topics.response_text: Don't waste my time. I've got important things to do around here.

topics.topic_text: Your father was a monarch? You mean like the butterfly?
topics.response_text: How much radiation have you been exposed to? Not the butterfly, you moron. I meant the kind of leader that holds his office for life.

topics.topic_text: I seek citizenship in the Republic of Dave.
topics.response_text: First off, you will address me as Mister President. Always. No exceptions.

topics.topic_text: I'd say it looks more like a dictatorship.
topics.response_text: Dictatorship? You insult me. Obviously the Wasteland radiation has taken away your capacity to reason.

topics.topic_text: I really wouldn't know. I just got here.
topics.response_text: Ah, a seeker of knowledge, then? Well, trust me, an election is what separates a president like myself from a monarch like my father.

topics.topic_text: Yes, absolutely.
topics.response_text: Well then, there you go.  An election is what separates a president like myself from a monarch like my father.

topics.topic_text: What am I supposed to do?
topics.response_text: What am I supposed to do?{Mocking/Mimics the player.}

topics.topic_text: There must be something I can do to stay.
topics.response_text: Hmm... now that you mention it, the President could use a new hunting rifle.

topics.topic_text: What if I just make a donation to the Republic... and you let me stay?
topics.response_text: A donation, huh? Well, it just so happens that the Republic of Dave does grant special asylum to its supporters in times of crisis.

topics.topic_text: You crazy, condescending asshole! No one exiles me!
topics.response_text: Have it your way. You'll never leave the Republic. Alive, that is.

topics.topic_text: A Hunting Rifle? Fine, I'll be back with one.
topics.response_text: Very well. I look forward to it, future refugee.

topics.topic_text: I'll be back with 250 caps.
topics.response_text: Very well. I look forward to it, future refugee.

topics.topic_text: I'm not giving you anything.
topics.response_text: Then you have 24 hours to remain in the Republic or face execution. Enjoy your stay.

topics.topic_text: So, your father was a monarch and you're a president? How does that work?
topics.response_text: My father inherited his political power from birth and renamed this great nation the Kingdom of Tom.

topics.topic_text: No, of course not!
topics.response_text: Ah-ha! Just what I'd expect a spy to say! Look, I don't know how you got in here, spy, but there will be consequences for your actions.

topics.topic_text: Spy on what?  Your trailer-home?
topics.response_text: If the Capitol Building does not meet your incredible standards, feel free to escort yourself out.  In fact, just leave now.

topics.topic_text: I don't consider myself a spy so much as... your assassin.
topics.response_text: Assassin?  And you really thought you could succeed against the Army of Dave?

topics.topic_text: Nobody talks to me that way.
topics.response_text: The President of the Republic does. Now get out of my sight.

topics.topic_text: I'm just a traveler. I guess you could say I'm vacationing.
topics.response_text: The Department of Tourist Rights has declared a tourism embargo that affects the entirety of the Republic of Dave.

topics.topic_text: I've got to go.
topics.response_text: You've wasted enough presidential time. Be gone.

topics.topic_text: Actually, I think I have all the info I need.
topics.response_text: Anything else?

topics.topic_text: Who's running in the election?
topics.response_text: Nobody except me. Why would the people need anyone else but Dave? I give them all that they ask for.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to throw my hat into the ring and run for the presidency.
topics.response_text: I'm sorry, but the president must be a citizen of the Republic to run for office.  So you do not qualify.

topics.topic_text: Who's eligible to vote?
topics.response_text: That would be Bob, Shawna, Jessica, Rosie and myself. In the Republic, if you're old enough to carry a weapon, you're old enough to vote.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to discuss the election with you.
topics.response_text: The election is still going on. What do you want to know?

topics.topic: RDTopicGoVoteYou should go vote, if you haven't already.
topics.topic_text: Did you already vote, Mister President?
topics.response_text: Of course I voted. I was the first to vote. Now I'm just waiting for the rest of the votes to come in.

topics.topic_text: Your Republic is forfeit. Prepare to be reclaimed by the Wasteland!
topics.response_text: Let's see what the Army of Dave has to say about that, invader!

topics.topic: RDTopicRoDI'd like to know more about the Republic.
topics.topic_text: Anything happening in this place, Mister President?
topics.response_text: There's an election for the next president.

topics.topic_text: That's all I need to know.
topics.response_text: Well, good for you then.{Sarcasm}

topics.topic_text: Could I help with the election, Mister President?
topics.response_text: Alright sure, why not. The people have a tendency to wait until the last minute to vote, but I'd just like to get it over with.

topics.topic_text: Forget it, Dave. I'm not giving you any secrets.
topics.response_text: Then you are hereby exiled from the Republic of Dave.

topics.topic_text: I come from the Land of the Mirelurks! They demand you surrender the Republic!
topics.response_text: The Republic of Dave does not recognize the rights of Mirelurks or the sovereignty of any Mirelurk nation.

topics.topic_text: My nation is a helpless, unarmed village to the north. We beg your assistance.
topics.response_text: My assistance? Hmm... I suppose I can spare a few caps from the Department of Foreign Relations budget. Here.

topics.topic_text: My former nation was a Vault. The only secrets were kept by the Overseer.
topics.response_text: Interesting... um... well, the Republic of Dave is glad to welcome a former Vault citizen to our fair nation.{Dave wasn't expecting that one.}

topics.topic: RDTopicThisPlaceWhat's your take on the Republic?
topics.topic_text: Any future plans for the Republic, Mister President?
topics.response_text: Well, the Republic of Dave is the only true sovereign nation in the Wasteland. The only really civilized place left in the world.

topics.topic: RDTopicWhosInChargeTell me more about this Dave guy.
topics.topic_text: So, you're in charge here, Mister President?
topics.response_text: That's right. As president, I am head of the Department of Tourist Rights, the Office of Immigrant Affairs, and the Bureau of Davelike Activities.

topics.topic_text: You have two wives, Mister President?
topics.response_text: Of course. As President of the Republic, I have a mandate to repopulate the Wasteland.

topics.topic: RDTopicYourselfWhat can you tell me about yourself?
topics.topic_text: I'd be interested in learning more about you, Mister President.
topics.response_text: Years ago, I freed these poor people from the wrath of Tom, former monarch of the Kingdom of Tom.

topics.topic_text: SpeechChallengeFailure
topics.response_text: Mister Crowley was a mercenary I worked with a long time ago.

conversation.response_text: Ah! It's the keeper of the key.
I keep telling you, it's Mister President! Now get back to guarding the gate!
Let's see what we have here.
